WellPlanningActivities.Name: Make up BHA
WellPlanningActivities.Comments:
Make up BHA consisting of: Components, quantity
        Apply make-up torque to all components using the values from the next table:
        It is necessary to test downhole tools at _____ depth

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Drill to depth
WellPlanningActivities.Comments:
Drill from _____ to _____ ft (expected TD)
        Drill at reduced drilling parameters until _____.
        RPM = _____
        Flow in rate = _____
        WOB = _____
        Continue drilling to _____ ft (_____ ft inside/below _____ formation) using the following parameters as a reference.
        WOB= _____ – _____
        RPM= _____ – _____
        Torque ma _____ = _____
        Differential pressure= _____ – _____
        Flow in rate= _____ – _____
        Expected ROP= _____ – _____
        It is expected to drill through _____ formation which is at _____ ft, this formation is defined _____ and then the next formation to drill is _____ which is _____
        Take survey every _____ ft (refer to the _____ document for more information about the best practices when taking survey).
        Pump _____ every _____.
        In case of _____ losses during drilling, refer to _____ and apply the mitigation actions.
        The mud weight must be in the _____ – _____ ppg range. The plan is to increase _____ ppg every _____ ft.
        This section is planned to _____. The technical limit is _____ from the plan directional.
        To prevent _____ in the hole, pump _____ every _____ ft.
        The hole clean index shows that with the proposed parameters the hole cleaning is _____

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Circulate to condition hole
WellPlanningActivities.Comments:
At TD, circulate hole clean. Pump a _____ bbl _____ and circulate until shakers are clean. Maintain GPM= _____, RPM=_____ and work and condition hole as needed.
        Spot _____ bbl of _____ to cover the _____ formation.

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Pump slug_sweep_pill_spacer
WellPlanningActivities.Comments: Pump _____ to _____ wellbore with _____ m3/bbl hi-vis pill _____ ppg/sg _____

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Trip out to depth
WellPlanningActivities.Comments:
Trip out of the hole to surface to log the well.
        Pump _____ bbl to trip out of hole dry.
        To avoid swabbing effect do not exceed from _____ minute on open hole and _____ minute in cased hole.
        Monitor torque and drag closely.
        Do not over pull more than _____.
        Observe wellbore condition while.
        Fill up the well using the trip tank every _____ stands and record in the trip sheet.
        In case of tight wellbore _____.
        Follow _____: Backreaming and Reaming Recommended Practices.
        Measure the drill string during pulling out of the hole.
        Use an open drift _____._____ minimum inside the drill string.
        Based on the simulation the expected pick up weight should be: _____ and the slack off weight _____.

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Lay down BHA
WellPlanningActivities.Comments: Lay down entire BHA

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Rig up to run casing
WellPlanningActivities.Comments:
Rig up _____ casing running equipment.
        Ensure _____ is aligned with rotary prior to attempting to make up casing.

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Run in casing to depth
WellPlanningActivities.Comments:
Run in to the hole _____ casing as follow:
        Place DV tool _____ m above _____ formation.
        Single _____ shoe + _____ joint(s) casing + _____ collar.
        Use _____ torque in each component.
        Run _____ centralizers (_____ centralizers).
        _____ every _____ joint up to _____ (to be updated with the cementing program)
        Make sure that no coupling is on the casing cut distance (about _____-_____ from RKB).
        Use a _____ length joint ~_____ to space out and allow slips and casing cut distance.
        While running in hole with casing, monitor displacements and flow out using the trip sheet.
        Fill pipe at minimum of every _____ and break circulation every _____.
        If flow out is reduced or proper displacement returns are not seen, _____.
        Always break circulation slowly to reduce ECD due to gel strengths.
        The tripping speed should be limited to _____ sec per joint.
        If you find tight spots during the trip, do not apply more than _____ klbs in the casing string.
        Do not over pull more than _____.
        To activate the emergency slips in the well head is required at least _____ klbs.

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Make up wellhead running tool to casing
Rig down after casing run
WellPlanningActivities.Comments: Rig down equipment

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Rig up to cement casing
WellPlanningActivities.Comments:
Make up cement head and lines
        Test cement lines to _____/_____ psi - _____/_____ min respectively.
        This test will be accepted if _____

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Circulate to condition hole prior to cementation
Perform single stage cement job
WellPlanningActivities.Comments:
Cementing Supervisor to ensure that all valves are lined up properly to launch wiper plug out of cement head during the start of the displacement with _____ base mud _____._____ ppg using _____ to displace.
        Thickening time= _____ hours
        Pumping time= _____ hours
        Lead: _____._____ ppg Class _____ cement with planned Top at _____, _____ volume + _____ %  = _____ bbls
        Tail: _____._____ ppg Class _____ cement with planned Top at _____, _____ volume + _____ %  = _____ bbls
        Bump the plug with _____ psi over the final pressure (expected _____ psi).
        Do not over displace beyond _____ % of shoe track volume to bump plug.
        Be prepared to take excess cement returns out to the reserve pits.
        Release pressure and check to see that the floats are holding.
        If the floats fail to hold, _____
        If cement does not circulate to surface, _____.
        Prepare for _____.

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Rig down after cementing casing
WellPlanningActivities.Comments: Rig down cementing head and cementing lines.

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Install well head
WellPlanningActivities.Comments:
Install _____ _____ M _____ and _____ Section of multibowl wellhead.
        Ensure right direction of the valves of the wellhead for the well.
        The _____ casing cut such that top of _____ Section is _____ _____ ground level.
        Confirm all measurements with welder and wellhead technician and ensure there is room in substructure for BOP and rotating head before commencing job.
        Follow wellhead technician installation procedure.
        Test _____ Section seals to _____ % collapse of _____ casing _____ psi.

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Nipple up B.O.P
WellPlanningActivities.Comments: BOP stack configuration as per operators guidelines.

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Test B.O.P
WellPlanningActivities.Comments:
Test BOPE, spool, choke/kill lines and choke manifold to _____ psi low / _____ psi high.
        Test annular BOP to _____ psi low / _____ psi high (_____% of working pressure).
        • All BOP tests to be charted and are valid for _____ days.
        • BOP drills should be conducted no less than once per week with each rig crew.
        • Ensure _____ Section valve open during BOP test to monitor for test plug leak.

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Run wear bushing
WellPlanningActivities.Comments:
Keep a record of the distance between the KB and the well head.
        Specific operational procedure

WellPlanningActivities.Name: Circulate to condition hole prior to cementation
Perform two stage cement job
WellPlanningActivities.Comments:
Pump _____ Mi _____ and pump _____ slurry _____ will be added to the slurry in case losses are observed while RIH casing or while circulating before the cement job
        Drop 1st stage shut-off plug
        Displace cement slurry with _____ pumps.
        Bump plug with _____ psi over the final displacement pressure.
        Bleed off pressure and check for returns and back flow.
        Drop the free-fall opening device and wait until the free-fall opening device sets in DV collar (_____ min).
        Increase pressure slowly to _____ psi and hold for _____ min, DV ports should open, indicated by a sudden drop in pressure, Circulate _____ times volume above the DV Tool in the annulus with _____ ppg/sg drilling fluid.
        Circulate about _____ bottoms up then WOC (circulate for _____ min every _____).
        Perform 2nd stage cement job. Pump lead slurry, followed by tail slurry.
        _____ will be added into tail slurry even if there was no losses while drilling, circulating or running the casing.
        • Drop DV closing plug
        • Displace cement, bump the plug.
        • Increase pressure to _____ psi to close the DV tool and hold for _____ mins. Bleed off pressure and observe for back flow
